additionalArguments.description: Additional arguments to be passed at Traefik's binary See [CLI Reference](https://docs.traefik.io/reference/static-configuration/cli/)

additionalVolumeMounts.description: Additional volumeMounts to add to the Traefik container

affinity.description: This example pod anti-affinity forces the scheduler to put traefik pods It should be used when hostNetwork: true to prevent port conflicts

behavior.description: behavior configures the scaling behavior of the target in both Up and Down directions (scaleUp and scaleDown fields respectively).

enabled.description: Create HorizontalPodAutoscaler object. See EXAMPLES.md for more details.

maxReplicas.description: maxReplicas is the upper limit for the number of pods that can be set by the autoscaler; cannot be smaller than MinReplicas.

metrics.description: metrics contains the specifications for which to use to calculate the desired replica count (the maximum replica count across all metrics will be used).

minReplicas.description: minReplicas is the lower limit for the number of replicas to which the autoscaler can scale down. It defaults to 1 pod.

scaleTargetRef.description: scaleTargetRef points to the target resource to scale, and is used for the pods for which metrics should be collected, as well as to actually change the replica count.

certificatesResolvers.description: Certificates resolvers configuration. Ref: https://doc.traefik.io/traefik/https/acme/#certificate-resolvers See EXAMPLES.md for more details.

commonLabels.description: Add additional label to all resources

defaultRuleSyntax.description: Can be used to use globally v2 router syntax. Deprecated since v3.4 /!\. See https://doc.traefik.io/traefik/v3.0/migration/v2-to-v3/#new-v3-syntax-notable-changes

additionalContainers.description: Additional containers (e.g. for metric offloading sidecars)

additionalVolumes.description: Additional volumes available for use with initContainers and additionalContainers

annotations.description: Additional deployment annotations (e.g. for jaeger-operator sidecar injection)

dnsPolicy.description: Custom pod DNS policy. Apply if `hostNetwork: true`

enabled.description: Enable deployment

goMemLimitPercentage.description: Percentage of memory limit to set for GOMEMLIMIT

imagePullSecrets.description: Pull secret for fetching traefik container image

initContainers.description: Additional initContainers (e.g. for setting file permission as shown below)

labels.description: Additional deployment labels (e.g. for filtering deployment by custom labels)

minReadySeconds.description: The minimum number of seconds Traefik needs to be up and running before the DaemonSet/Deployment controller considers it available

podAnnotations.description: Additional pod annotations (e.g. for mesh injection or prometheus scraping) It supports templating. One can set it with values like traefik/name: '{{ template "traefik.name" . }}'

podLabels.description: Additional Pod labels (e.g. for filtering Pod by custom labels) It supports templating. One can set it with values like traefik/name: '{{ template "traefik.name" . }}'

replicas.description: Number of pods of the deployment (only applies when kind == Deployment)

revisionHistoryLimit.description: Number of old history to retain to allow rollback (If not set, default Kubernetes value is set to 10)

terminationGracePeriodSeconds.description: Amount of time (in seconds) before Kubernetes will send the SIGKILL signal if Traefik does not shut down

enabled.description: Allow the Helm chart to be used as optional subchart.

env.description: Additional Environment variables to be passed to Traefik's binary

envFrom.description: Environment variables to be passed to Traefik's binary from configMaps or secrets

abortOnPluginFailure.description: Defines whether all plugins must be loaded successfully for Traefik to start

debug.description: Enable debug mode for the FastProxy implementation.

enabled.description: Enables the FastProxy implementation.
Enable traefik experimental GatewayClass CRD

extraObjects.description: Extra objects to deploy (value evaluated as a template)  In some cases, it can avoid the need for additional, extended or adhoc deployments. See #595 for more details and traefik/tests/values/extra.yaml for example.

fullnameOverride.description: Overrides the resource name for templates (i.e deployment, service, etc..)

defaultScope.description: Configure this Gateway as a [Default Gateway](https://kubernetes.io/blog/2025/11/06/gateway-api-v1-4/#introducing-default-gateways) by setting the `defaultScope` field (e.g. `All` or `Namespace`).

enabled.description: When providers.kubernetesGateway.enabled, deploy a default gateway

namespacePolicy.description: Routes are restricted to namespace of the gateway [by default](https://gateway-api.sigs.k8s.io/reference/spec/#gateway.networking.k8s.io/v1.FromNamespaces

port.description: Port is the network port. Multiple listeners may use the same port, subject to the Listener compatibility rules. The port must match a port declared in ports section.

name.description: Set a custom name to gateway

namespace.description: By default, Gateway is created in the same `Namespace` as Traefik.

enabled.description: When providers.kubernetesGateway.enabled and gateway.enabled, deploy a default gatewayClass

labels.description: Additional gatewayClass labels (e.g. for filtering gateway objects by custom labels)

name.description: Set a custom name to GatewayClass

azure.description: Required for Azure Marketplace integration. See https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/partner-center/marketplace-offers/azure-container-technical-assets-kubernetes?tabs=linux,linux2#update-the-helm-chart

sendAnonymousUsage.description: Please take time to consider whether or not you wish to share anonymous data with us See https://doc.traefik.io/traefik/contributing/data-collection/

hostNetwork.description: If hostNetwork is true, runs traefik in the host network namespace To prevent unschedulable pods due to port collisions, if hostNetwork=true and replicas>1, a pod anti-affinity is recommended and will be set if the affinity is left as default.

enabled.description: Set to true in order to enable AI Gateway. Requires a valid license token.

maxRequestBodySize.description: Hard limit for the size of request bodies inspected by the gateway. Accepts a plain integer representing **bytes**. The default value is `1048576` (1 MiB).

customWebhookCertificate.description: Set custom certificate for the WebHook admission server. The certificate should be specified with _tls.crt_ and _tls.key_ in base64 encoding.

listenAddr.description: WebHook admission server listen address. Default: "0.0.0.0:9943".

restartOnCertificateChange.description: Set it to false if you need to disable Traefik Hub pod restart when mutating webhook certificate is updated. It's done with a label update.

secretName.description: Certificate name of the WebHook admission server. Default: "hub-agent-cert".

selfManagedCertificate.description: By default, this chart handles directly the tls certificate required for the admission webhook. It's possible to disable this behavior and handle it outside of the chart. See EXAMPLES.md for more details.

enabled.description: Set to true in order to enable API Management. Requires a valid license token.

validateRequestMethodAndPath.description: When set to true, it will only accept paths and methods that are explicitly defined in its OpenAPI specification

enabled.description: Set to true in order to enable AI MCP Gateway. Requires a valid license token.

maxRequestBodySize.description: Hard limit for the size of request bodies inspected by the gateway. Accepts a plain integer representing **bytes**. The default value is `1048576` (1 MiB).

namespaces.description: By default, Traefik Hub provider watches all namespaces. When using `rbac.namespaced`, it will watch helm release namespace and namespaces listed in this array.

cache.description: Use local agent caching for catalog reads.

connectByDefault.description: Consider every service as Connect capable by default.

constraints.description: Constraints is an expression that Traefik matches against the container's labels

enabled.description: Enable Consul Catalog Enterprise backend with default settings.

address.description: The address of the Consul server

datacenter.description: Data center to use. If not provided, the default agent data center is used

endpointWaitTime.description: WaitTime limits how long a Watch will block. If not provided, the agent default

scheme.description: The URI scheme for the Consul server

token.description: Token is used to provide a per-request ACL token which overrides the agent's

namespaces.description: Sets the namespaces used to discover services (Consul Enterprise only).

partition.description: Sets the partition used to discover services (Consul Enterprise only).

requireConsistent.description: Forces the read to be fully consistent.

serviceName.description: Name of the Traefik service in Consul Catalog (needs to be registered via the

stale.description: Use stale consistency for catalog reads.

strictChecks.description: A list of service health statuses to allow taking traffic.

enabled.description: Enable Microcks provider.

database.description: Database used to store information. Default: "0".

endpoints.description: Endpoints of the Redis instances to connect to. Default: "".

password.description: The password to use when connecting to Redis endpoints. Default: "".

masterset.description: Name of the set of main nodes to use for main selection. Required when using Sentinel. Default: "".

password.description: Password to use for sentinel authentication (can be different from endpoint password). Default: "".

username.description: Username to use for sentinel authentication (can be different from endpoint username). Default: "".

timeout.description: Timeout applied on connection with redis. Default: "0s".

ca.description: Path to the certificate authority used for the secured connection.

cert.description: Path to the public certificate used for the secure connection.

insecureSkipVerify.description: When insecureSkipVerify is set to true, the TLS connection accepts any certificate presented by the server. Default: false.

key.description: Path to the private key used for the secure connection.

username.description: The username to use when connecting to Redis endpoints. Default: "".

token.description: Name of `Secret` with key 'token' set to a valid license token. It enables API Gateway.

enabled.description: Tracing headers to duplicate. To configure the following, tracing.otlp.enabled needs to be set to true.

parentId.description: Name of the header that will contain the parent-id header copy.

traceId.description: Name of the header that will contain the trace-id copy.

traceParent.description: Name of the header that will contain the traceparent copy.

traceState.description: Name of the header that will contain the tracestate copy.

tag.description: defaults to appVersion. It's used for version checking, even prefixed with experimental- or latest-. When a digest is required, `versionOverride` can be used to set the version.

enabled.description: Create a default IngressClass for Traefik

ingressRoute.description: Only dashboard & healthcheck IngressRoute are supported. It's recommended to create workloads CR outside of this Chart.

enabled.description: Create an IngressRoute for the dashboard

entryPoints.description: Specify the allowed entrypoints to use for the dashboard ingress route, (e.g. traefik, web, websecure). By default, it's using traefik entrypoint, which is not exposed. /!\ Do not expose your dashboard without any protection over the internet /!\

labels.description: Additional ingressRoute labels (e.g. for filtering IngressRoute by custom labels)

matchRule.description: The router match rule used for the dashboard ingressRoute

services.description: The internal service used for the dashboard ingressRoute

enabled.description: Create an IngressRoute for the healthcheck probe

entryPoints.description: Specify the allowed entrypoints to use for the healthcheck ingress route, (e.g. traefik, web, websecure). By default, it's using traefik entrypoint, which is not exposed.

labels.description: Additional ingressRoute labels (e.g. for filtering IngressRoute by custom labels)

matchRule.description: The router match rule used for the healthcheck ingressRoute

services.description: The internal service used for the healthcheck ingressRoute

instanceLabelOverride.description: This field overrides the default app.kubernetes.io/instance label for all Objects.

failureThreshold.description: The number of consecutive failures allowed before considering the probe as failed.

initialDelaySeconds.description: The number of seconds to wait before starting the first probe.

periodSeconds.description: The number of seconds to wait between consecutive probes.

successThreshold.description: The minimum consecutive successes required to consider the probe successful.

timeoutSeconds.description: The number of seconds to wait for a probe response before considering it as failed.

addInternals.description: Enables accessLogs for internal resources. Default: false.

enabled.description: To enable access logs

names.description: Names of the fields to limit.

minduration.description: Set minDuration, to keep access logs when requests take longer than the specified duration

retryattempts.description: Set retryAttempts, to keep the access logs when at least one retry has happened

statuscodes.description: Set statusCodes, to limit the access logs to requests with a status codes in the specified range

enabled.description: Set to true in order to enable OpenTelemetry on access logs. Note that experimental.otlpLogs needs to be enabled.
Set to true in order to send access logs to the OpenTelemetry Collector using gRPC

insecure.description: Allows reporter to send access logs to the OpenTelemetry Collector without using a secured protocol.

ca.description: The path to the certificate authority, it defaults to the system bundle.

cert.description: The path to the public certificate. When using this option, setting the key option is required.

insecureSkipVerify.description: When set to true, the TLS connection accepts any certificate presented by the server regardless of the hostnames it covers.

key.description: The path to the private key. When using this option, setting the cert option is required.

enabled.description: Set to true in order to send access logs to the OpenTelemetry Collector using HTTP.

headers.description: Additional headers sent with access logs by the reporter to the OpenTelemetry Collector.

cert.description: The path to the public certificate. When using this option, setting the key option is required.

insecureSkipVerify.description: When set to true, the TLS connection accepts any certificate presented by the server regardless of the hostnames it covers.

key.description: The path to the private key. When using this option, setting the cert option is required.

resourceAttributes.description: Defines additional resource attributes to be sent to the collector.

serviceName.description: Service name used in OTLP backend. Default: traefik.

filePath.description: To write the logs into a log file, use the filePath option.

level.description: Alternative logging levels are TRACE, DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL, and PANIC.

noColor.description: When set to true and format is common, it disables the colorized output.

enabled.description: Set to true in order to enable OpenTelemetry on logs. Note that experimental.otlpLogs needs to be enabled.
Set to true in order to send logs  to the OpenTelemetry Collector using gRPC

insecure.description: Allows reporter to send logs to the OpenTelemetry Collector without using a secured protocol.

cert.description: The path to the public certificate. When using this option, setting the key option is required.

insecureSkipVerify.description: When set to true, the TLS connection accepts any certificate presented by the server regardless of the hostnames it covers.

key.description: The path to the private key. When using this option, setting the cert option is required.

enabled.description: Set to true in order to send logs to the OpenTelemetry Collector using HTTP.

headers.description: Additional headers sent with logs by the reporter to the OpenTelemetry Collector.

insecureSkipVerify.description: When set to true, the TLS connection accepts any certificate presented by the server regardless of the hostnames it covers.

key.description: The path to the private key. When using this option, setting the cert option is required.

resourceAttributes.description: Defines additional resource attributes to be sent to the collector.

serviceName.description: Service name used in OTLP backend. Default: traefik.

addInternals.description: Enable metrics for internal resources. Default: false

addEntryPointsLabels.description: Enable metrics on entry points. Default: true

addRoutersLabels.description: Enable metrics on routers. Default: false

addServicesLabels.description: Enable metrics on services. Default: true

enabled.description: Set to true in order to enable the OpenTelemetry metrics

explicitBoundaries.description: Explicit boundaries for Histogram data points. Default: [.005, .01, .025, .05, .1, .25, .5, 1, 2.5, 5, 10]

enabled.description: Set to true in order to send metrics to the OpenTelemetry Collector using gRPC

insecure.description: Allows reporter to send metrics to the OpenTelemetry Collector without using a secured protocol.

ca.description: The path to the certificate authority, it defaults to the system bundle.

cert.description: The path to the public certificate. When using this option, setting the key option is required.

insecureSkipVerify.description: When set to true, the TLS connection accepts any certificate presented by the server regardless of the hostnames it covers.

key.description: The path to the private key. When using this option, setting the cert option is required.

enabled.description: Set to true in order to send metrics to the OpenTelemetry Collector using HTTP.

headers.description: Additional headers sent with metrics by the reporter to the OpenTelemetry Collector.

ca.description: The path to the certificate authority, it defaults to the system bundle.

cert.description: The path to the public certificate. When using this option, setting the key option is required.

insecureSkipVerify.description: When set to true, the TLS connection accepts any certificate presented by the server regardless of the hostnames it covers.

key.description: The path to the private key. When using this option, setting the cert option is required.

pushInterval.description: Interval at which metrics are sent to the OpenTelemetry Collector. Default: 10s

resourceAttributes.description: Defines additional resource attributes to be sent to the collector.

serviceName.description: Service name used in OTLP backend. Default: traefik.

addEntryPointsLabels.description: Enable metrics on entry points. Default: true

addRoutersLabels.description: Enable metrics on routers. Default: false

addServicesLabels.description: Enable metrics on services. Default: true

disableAPICheck.description: When set to true, it won't check if Prometheus Operator CRDs are deployed

entryPoint.description: Entry point used to expose metrics.

headerLabels.description: Add HTTP header labels to metrics. See EXAMPLES.md or upstream doc for usage.

manualRouting.description: When manualRouting is true, it disables the default internal router in # order to allow creating a custom router for prometheus@internal service.

enabled.description: Enable optional CR for Prometheus Operator. See EXAMPLES.md for more details.
Create a dedicated metrics service to use with ServiceMonitor
Enable optional CR for Prometheus Operator. See EXAMPLES.md for more details.

namespaceOverride.description: This field overrides the default Release Namespace for Helm. It will not affect optional CRDs such as `ServiceMonitor` and `PrometheusRules`

nodeSelector.description: nodeSelector is the simplest recommended form of node selection constraint.

oci_meta.description: Required for OCI Marketplace integration. See https://docs.public.content.oci.oraclecloud.com/en-us/iaas/Content/Marketplace/understanding-helm-charts.htm

enabled.description: Enable specific values for Oracle Cloud Infrastructure

repo.description: It needs to be an ocir repo

enabled.description: Enable OCSP stapling support. See https://doc.traefik.io/traefik/https/ocsp/#overview

responderOverrides.description: Defines the OCSP responder URLs to use instead of the one provided by the certificate.

enabled.description: Enable persistence using Persistent Volume Claims ref: http://kubernetes.io/docs/user-guide/persistent-volumes/. It can be used to store TLS certificates along with `certificatesResolvers.<name>.acme.storage`  option

subPath.description: Only mount a subpath of the Volume into the pod

podSecurityPolicy.description: Enable to create a PodSecurityPolicy and assign it to the Service Account via RoleBinding or ClusterRoleBinding

expose.description: You may not want to expose the metrics port on production deployments. If you want to access it from outside your cluster, use `kubectl port-forward` or create a secure ingress

exposedPort.description: The exposed port for this service

hostIP.description: Use hostIP if set. If not set, Kubernetes will default to 0.0.0.0, which means it's listening on all your interfaces and all your IPs. You may want to set this value if you need traefik to listen on specific interface only.

maxHeaderBytes.description: Maximum size of request headers in bytes. Default: 1048576 (1 MB)

entryPoint.description: Port Redirections Added in 2.2, one can make permanent redirects via entrypoints. Same sets of parameters: to, scheme, permanent and priority. https://doc.traefik.io/traefik/reference/install-configuration/entrypoints/#configuration-example

enabled.description: See [upstream documentation](https://doc.traefik.io/traefik/reference/install-configuration/entrypoints/#opt-http-tls)

traceVerbosity.description: Defines the tracing verbosity level for this entryPoint.

port.description: When using hostNetwork, use another port to avoid conflict with node exporter: https://github.com/prometheus/prometheus/wiki/Default-port-allocations

trustedIPs.description: Enable the Proxy Protocol header parsing for the entry point

content.description: File content (YAML format, go template supported) (see https://doc.traefik.io/traefik/providers/file/)

enabled.description: Create a file provider

watch.description: Allows Traefik to automatically watch for file changes

enabled.description: Enable Knative provider

namespaces.description: Array of namespaces to watch. If left empty, Traefik watches all namespaces. . When using `rbac.namespaced`, it will watch helm release namespace and namespaces listed in this array.

allowCrossNamespace.description: Allows IngressRoute to reference resources in namespace other than theirs

allowEmptyServices.description: Allows to return 503 when there are no endpoints available

allowExternalNameServices.description: Allows to reference ExternalName services in IngressRoute

enabled.description: Load Kubernetes IngressRoute provider

ingressClass.description: When the parameter is set, only resources containing an annotation with the same value are processed. Otherwise, resources missing the annotation, having an empty value, or the value traefik are processed. It will also set required annotation on Dashboard and Healthcheck IngressRoute when enabled.

namespaces.description: Array of namespaces to watch. If left empty, Traefik watches all namespaces. . When using `rbac.namespaced`, it will watch helm release namespace and namespaces listed in this array.

nativeLBByDefault.description: Defines whether to use Native Kubernetes load-balancing mode by default.

enabled.description: Enable Traefik Gateway provider for Gateway API

experimentalChannel.description: Toggles support for the Experimental Channel resources (Gateway API release channels documentation). This option currently enables support for TCPRoute and TLSRoute.

labelSelector.description: A label selector can be defined to filter on specific GatewayClass objects only.

namespaces.description: Array of namespaces to watch. If left empty, Traefik watches all namespaces. . When using `rbac.namespaced`, it will watch helm release namespace and namespaces listed in this array.

nativeLBByDefault.description: Defines whether to use Native Kubernetes load-balancing mode by default.

hostname.description: This Hostname will get copied to the Gateway status.addresses.

ip.description: This IP will get copied to the Gateway status.addresses, and currently only supports one IP value (IPv4 or IPv6).

enabled.description: The Kubernetes service to copy status addresses from. When using third parties tools like External-DNS, this option can be used to copy the service loadbalancer.status (containing the service's endpoints IPs) to the gateways. Default to Service of this Chart.

allowEmptyServices.description: Allows to return 503 when there are no endpoints available

allowExternalNameServices.description: Allows to reference ExternalName services in Ingress

disableIngressClassLookup.description: Only for Traefik v3.0, Deprecated since v3.1. See [upstream documentation](https://doc.traefik.io/traefik/v3.0/providers/kubernetes-ingress/#disableingressclasslookup)

enabled.description: Load Kubernetes Ingress provider

ingressClass.description: When ingressClass is set, only Ingresses containing an annotation with the same value are processed. Otherwise, Ingresses missing the annotation, having an empty value, or the value traefik are processed.

namespaces.description: Array of namespaces to watch. If left empty, Traefik watches all namespaces. . When using `rbac.namespaced`, it will watch helm release namespace and namespaces listed in this array.

nativeLBByDefault.description: Defines whether to use Native Kubernetes load-balancing mode by default.

enabled.description: Enable [publishedService](https://doc.traefik.io/traefik/providers/kubernetes-ingress/#publishedservice), usually with the Service provided by this Chart. It's possible to use it with an external Service using pathOverride.

pathOverride.description: Override path of Kubernetes Service used to copy status from. Format: namespace/servicename. Default to Service deployed with this Chart.

strictPrefixMatching.description: Defines whether to make prefix matching strictly comply with the Kubernetes Ingress specification.

certAuthFilePath.description: Kubernetes certificate authority file path (not needed for in-cluster client)

controllerClass.description: Ingress Class Controller value this controller satisfies

defaultBackendService.description: Service used to serve HTTP requests not matching any known server name (catch-all). Takes the form 'namespace/name'

disableSvcExternalName.description: Disable support for Services of type ExternalName

enabled.description: Enable Kubernetes Ingress NGINX provider (experimental)

endpoint.description: Kubernetes server endpoint (required for external cluster client)

ingressClass.description: Name of the ingress class this controller satisfies

ingressClassByName.description: Define if Ingress Controller should watch for Ingress Class by Name together with Controller Class

enabled.description: Service fronting the Ingress controller. Takes the form 'namespace/name'

publishStatusAddress.description: Customized address (or addresses, separated by comma) to set as the load-balancer status of Ingress objects this controller satisfies

token.description: Kubernetes bearer token (not needed for in-cluster client). It accepts either a token value or a file path to the token

watchIngressWithoutClass.description: Define if Ingress Controller should also watch for Ingresses without an IngressClass or the annotation specified

watchNamespace.description: Namespace the controller watches for updates to Kubernetes objects. Mutually exclusive with watchNamespaceSelector.

watchNamespaceSelector.description: Select namespaces the controller watches for updates to Kubernetes objects. Mutually exclusive with watchNamespace.

enabled.description: Whether Role Based Access Control objects like roles and rolebindings should be created

failureThreshold.description: The number of consecutive failures allowed before considering the probe as failed.

initialDelaySeconds.description: The number of seconds to wait before starting the first probe.

periodSeconds.description: The number of seconds to wait between consecutive probes.

successThreshold.description: The minimum consecutive successes required to consider the probe successful.

timeoutSeconds.description: The number of seconds to wait for a probe response before considering it as failed.

annotations.description: Additional annotations applied to both TCP and UDP services (e.g. for cloud provider specific config)

annotationsTCP.description: Additional annotations for TCP service only

annotationsUDP.description: Additional annotations for UDP service only

labels.description: Additional service labels (e.g. for filtering Service by custom labels)

spec.description: Additional entries here will be added to the service spec.

serviceAccount.description: The service account the pods will use to interact with the Kubernetes API

serviceAccountAnnotations.description: Additional serviceAccount annotations (e.g. for oidc authentication)

tlsOptions.description: TLS Options are created as [TLSOption CRDs](https://doc.traefik.io/traefik/https/tls/#tls-options) When using `labelSelector`, you'll need to set labels on tlsOption accordingly. See EXAMPLE.md for details.

tlsStore.description: TLS Store are created as [TLSStore CRDs](https://doc.traefik.io/traefik/https/tls/#default-certificate). This is useful if you want to set a default certificate. See EXAMPLE.md for details.

tolerations.description: Tolerations allow the scheduler to schedule pods with matching taints.

topologySpreadConstraints.description: You can use topology spread constraints to control how Pods are spread across your cluster among failure-domains.

addInternals.description: Enables tracing for internal resources. Default: false.

capturedRequestHeaders.description: Defines the list of request headers to add as attributes. It applies to client and server kind spans.

capturedResponseHeaders.description: Defines the list of response headers to add as attributes. It applies to client and server kind spans.

enabled.description: See https://doc.traefik.io/traefik/v3.0/observability/tracing/opentelemetry/
Set to true in order to send metrics to the OpenTelemetry Collector using gRPC

insecure.description: Allows reporter to send metrics to the OpenTelemetry Collector without using a secured protocol.

ca.description: The path to the certificate authority, it defaults to the system bundle.

cert.description: The path to the public certificate. When using this option, setting the key option is required.

insecureSkipVerify.description: When set to true, the TLS connection accepts any certificate presented by the server regardless of the hostnames it covers.

key.description: The path to the private key. When using this option, setting the cert option is required.

enabled.description: Set to true in order to send metrics to the OpenTelemetry Collector using HTTP.

headers.description: Additional headers sent with metrics by the reporter to the OpenTelemetry Collector.

ca.description: The path to the certificate authority, it defaults to the system bundle.

cert.description: The path to the public certificate. When using this option, setting the key option is required.

insecureSkipVerify.description: When set to true, the TLS connection accepts any certificate presented by the server regardless of the hostnames it covers.

key.description: The path to the private key. When using this option, setting the cert option is required.

resourceAttributes.description: Defines additional resource attributes to be sent to the collector.

safeQueryParams.description: By default, all query parameters are redacted. Defines the list of query parameters to not redact.

sampleRate.description: The proportion of requests to trace, specified between 0.0 and 1.0. Default: 1.0.

serviceName.description: Service name used in selected backend. Default: traefik.

type.description: Customize updateStrategy of Deployment or DaemonSet

versionOverride.description: This field overrides the default version extracted from image.tag

volumes.description: Add volumes to the traefik pod. The volume name will be passed to tpl. This can be used to mount a cert pair or a configmap that holds a config.toml file. After the volume has been mounted, add the configs into traefik by using the `additionalArguments` list below, eg: `additionalArguments:
